page.title: 10Shipley Parish Church today
page.content: St. Mary's Church, Shipley, holds 2 Sunday services with an average Sunday congregation of 60. There are about 6 weddings and 8 christenings a year. The choir has 3 male and 11 female members and there are 12 ringers for the church's 6 bells. The 15 strong Parochial Church Council handles the upkeep and management of the Church. In 1984 major works to the belfry were completed at a cost of Â£18,000. A monthly Parish Magazine gives details of the Sunday School, St. Mary's Guild and Coffee Mornings held for those who live alone. The composer John Ireland is buried in the churchyard. 1985 sees the{9th centenary of the Church}and in September celebrations, inaugurated by the Bishop of Chichester, will take place at the Church. Rather unusual is the fact that sheep are allowed to graze in the churchyard.
